snippet: As Democrats intensify attacks and even some Republicans urge him to relent, Mitt Romney has remained emphatic that two years of data are enough.
abstract: Mitt Romney remains steadfast in his refusal to release any of his tax returns from before 2010, despite millions of dollars in searing ads from Pres Obama and a rising chorus of frustrated Republicans.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and TRIP GABRIEL
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from New York, and Trip Gabriel from Bowling Green, Ohio.

lead_paragraph: As Democrats intensify attacks and even some Republicans urge him to relent, Mitt Romney has remained emphatic that two years of data are enough.

headline.seo: Romney Steadfast Against Release of More Tax Returns
headline.main: Romney Steadfast in the Face of Growing Calls to Release More Tax Returns
headline.print_headline: Romney Steadfast in the Face of Growing Calls to Release More Tax Returns
